page.title: 14FARMING
page.content: There are many farms that work this area.All are mixed farms,covering some one hundred and sixty six acres,mainly producing cereal crops and potatoes.Some of the land is used for producing arable grass.This is cut and harvested and stored to make silage for winter fodder,for the barley bulls.These only play a small part in the economy of the farm.A small section of land is unsuitable for crop growing,because the ground stays too wet so this is kept for open meadow.The next largest farm,120 acres,operates in much the same way.However this farm has a flock of 52 sheep and lambs.The smallest farm keeps quite a lot of animals,in all there are 24 horses,30 chickens and 4 dogs.The farm also has a good collection of machinery.
